entry.name: widget
entry.desc: Create stateful jQuery plugins using the same abstraction that all jQuery UI widgets.

longdesc.p: You can create new widgets from scratch, using just the $.Widget object as base to inherit from, or you can explicitly inherit from existing jQuery UI or third-party widgets.
For now, more details can be found at github.com/scottgonzalez/widget-factory-docs/

argument.name: options
argument.desc: A map of options to override defaults on initialization.

signature.desc: Call a widget method after initialization.

argument.name: method
argument.desc: The name of the method to call.
All additional arguments are passed as arguments to the method.

option.name: disabled
option.desc: Disables the widget if set to true.

method.name: _init
method.desc:
Widgets have the concept of initialization that is distinct from creation. Any time the plugin is called with no arguments or with only an option hash, the widget is initialized; this includes when the widget is created.
Initialization should only be handled if there is a logical action to perform on successive calls to the widget with no arguments.

method.name: _setOptions
method.desc:
Called with a hash of key/value pairs to set whenever the option() method is called, regardless of the form in which option() was called.
Overriding this is useful if you can defer processor-intensive changes for multiple option changes.

method.name: _setOption
method.desc:
Called from _setOptions() for each individual option.
Widget state should be updated based on changes.

method.name: _trigger
method.desc:
Triggers an event and its associated callback.
The option with the name equal to type is invoked as the callback.
The event name is the widget name + type.

argument.name: event
argument.desc: The original event that caused this event to occur; useful for providing context to the listener

argument.name: data
argument.desc: A hash of data associated with the event

event.name: create
event.desc: This event is triggered when the is created.
